website_summaries.verdict: This chainsaw rivals its gas-powered competition in terms of cutting speed and it charges very quickly.
pros: Brushless motor offers power equivalent to a gas chainsaw
Metal wraparound handle so you can hold it in multiple ways
cons: Users say it doesn't live up to its claim of 150 cuts on a single battery charge

customer_reviews.title: Avoid at all costs
customer_reviews.text: After owning for almost 3 years, the best thing I did was buy a different brand. Here are my reasons: 1. The chain jumps off track within 5 minutes of use... And sooner when you don't have a spanner on hand to fix it, which leads to... 2. It requires a wrench to fix chain issues and tighten. Other brands, such as Worx, don't need tools to do this. 3. The battery life is poor. 4. Remember #1? It pops up constantly. In all, I pulled it out after a year of un-use and reminded me how much I hate this thing, so I thought a review was warranted. Remember #1? It pops up constantly.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Pilgrim

customer_reviews.title: Not Impressed
customer_reviews.text: Caution, mine constantly leaks bar lube oil. I fill it a quarter of the way with cap off...it leaks out slowly. I tried everything...it leaks. I called their support line. They said it's normal. Other than that, it's alright unit. Greenworks does NOT have good product support. They've ignored my warranty e-mails. I'm filing a claim through BBB. Heads up!
customer_reviews.author: Real Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad customer service
customer_reviews.text: So far very unimpressed. The chainsaw showed up with a DOA battery so I called the manufacturer. She was very unapologetic and told me it would be 7-10 days AT LEAST for a replacement. This is even after I told her I purchased it to use this weekend. I’m going to wait because it’s easier than sending the whole thing back but I recommend buying a different brand as they don’t appear to stand by their products very well.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Defective Battery
customer_reviews.text: The battery is defective. When I put it in its charger, I just get a blinking red light, which the manual says makes it a defective battery. Its label states that is was made in 2017. I have contacted greenworks. If they give me a replacement that works, then I can try out the chainsaw and update this review. Update: Never heard back from greenworks. I returned it to Amazon. Amazon had UPS come out and pick it for free. Had the money back in a few days. Top marks to Amazon's return policy.
customer_reviews.author: T D

customer_reviews.title: Battery dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Battery was completely dead on arrival. Am contacting the manufacturer for replacement. The manufacturing date appears to be September 2017. Not sure why something manufactured 2+ years ago would still be offered for sale as new?
customer_reviews.author: Papa D

customer_reviews.title: Good but needs to stay operational longer
customer_reviews.text: I love it when it’s working but the chain comes off quite a lot, maybe every 4 minutes of actual cutting. I pull it tight when tightening the nuts but it doesn’t help. Cuts fast.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Jakubiak

customer_reviews.title: Best for a serious Homeowner. Cuts like a beast.
customer_reviews.text: This is built like a professional chain saw. And this is a great saw for the homeowner. On our new property we had a 20 felled trees that we pulled off the hill. This little beast went right through the biggest ones without a problem. The battery life is not great but chainsaws have a large power requirement. I suggest to keep the chain sharp. Keep a steady pressure let the saw do the work. Goes about 20 minutes on a charge. I highly recommend this saw.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Rumney

customer_reviews.title: Beats expectations. Never going back to gas powered saws
customer_reviews.text: Pleasantly surprised by how well this saw worked. Cuts as well as my gas powered saws of equal size. It's so nice to not have to deal with gas mix and the uncertainty of finicky gas saws. This one starts first time every time. One small flaw is that bar oil leaks in storage. I use a funnel to pour bar oil back in the bottle when finished cutting. Battery life is great. My back wears out way before the battery runs out. I bought several Green Works battery powered tools 8 or 9 years ago and they're still working. I expect many years of use with this saw.
customer_reviews.author: nil po

customer_reviews.title: Starts Easily and Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I love that I can start this chainsaw. I have always had a hard time starting equipment with the pull cords so having this chainsaw run on a battery and being able to simply push two buttons to start it easily is wonderful. And it is powerful too and the 80V battery lasts long enough for the jobs I use it on. I own several Greenworks products now and all have worked well and easily. No more pull cords for me ever again!
customer_reviews.author: Phil D

customer_reviews.title: Simple Chain Saw
customer_reviews.text: This is a lot simpler way to have the advantages of a chain saw without all the bother of a gas powered chain saw. No fuel mixing, no air filter to worry about and no pulling the cord until the 2 cycle engine catches. Just charge the battery on the included charger, fill the bar oilier and plug in the battery. Fires right up easy. After reading the instructions to work the safety switches. I used mine on some limbs and small tree. Worked fine, I really like it but keep in mind it only has an 18 inch bar. I like Greenworks, I have been using the 80V lawn mower for 2 years and love it too.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best invention ever
customer_reviews.text: Arm it, pull the trigger and your in business. No more pulling your guts out trying to start some stupid gas powered 2 cycle engine that has been sitting all year. I have another 80 volt product of theres so I will never worry about the battery life. The battery life last about as long as a tank of gas did on my old gas powered saw Only complaint is the bar is pretty thin and is not as stiff as the POS gas powered saw it replaced. But I can get a new bar.
customer_reviews.author: RBL

customer_reviews.title: Batteries get stuck inside of the tools
customer_reviews.text: Deal breaker! Huge problem with these batteries. They get stuck in the tool. EXTREMELY hard to remove. At this point I would not recommend any greenworks tools and I own them all. The batteries, I own 3, get stuck inside of all tools except for the mower. I’m not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: TheSharpElectricStar

customer_reviews.title: Battery Dies if Left in Chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: I left the Battery in the Chainsaw for a couple of months and the battery died and cannot be recharged. Greenworks says you should never keep the battery in the unit. That is just ridiculous. They want me to buy another battery. I told them I will throw the chainsaw away...no need to keep around junk much less spend more money to keep it running. update: 12/2018 After a few calls and bad reviews they sent me a new battery. finally....
customer_reviews.author: D. Sin

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied, with minor complaints
customer_reviews.text: Power is fine and work done per charge is as expected. I was a little dissatisfied with the chain-tensioning mechanism, which requires loosening two bar bolts with a wrench stored in the saw handle and then tightening or loosening a tensioning screw, but I'm not familiar with mechanisms on other saws. I also managed to throw the chain off the bar several times, usually when cutting brush, but I can't guarantee that I had the chain properly tensioned. As other reviewers have noted, the automatic shutoff after a few seconds of non-use seems unnecessary. Surely extending the shutoff delay tp a minute wouldn't consume much battery power.
customer_reviews.author: Coolgard

customer_reviews.title: No issues and worked well
customer_reviews.text: Been a while since I've used a chainsaw. Only complaint is that the chain was not on the gear when delivered but I did not realize it until I pulled the trigger. Chain got caught up under the cover and gouged it up a bit. So much for a nice new appearance. Anyway, I've used it through about 4 battery charges and no complaints. Works really well... would be nice if the cover wasn't gouged up though.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Light, easy to use, quiet, minimal vibration
customer_reviews.text: Nice to be able to cut wood quietly. Battery is nice for small jobs (image is about 80% of wood cut on one charge) within easy roaming distance of power and charges quickly. If I was cutting all day, I'd rotate between two batteries (charge one while cutting with the other) or alternate cutting and splitting (recharge while hauling and splitting). If cutting all day out in the deep woods, I'd use gas because easier to "recharge," but this battery-powered saw is nicer for neighborhood jobs. Plenty of power. Chain tightens easily. I'm happy with this saw.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt

customer_reviews.title: Good but frustrating when it throws a chain often
customer_reviews.text: I live on 18 acres and this thing does well regularly with 16 inch trees and old growth trees. Lightweight, good battery life. My problem with it is that it constantly throws its chain . The tool they include to fix the chain when thrown has a poorly designed storage in the chainsaw itself. you'll lose it quickly. when calling greenworks to get a replacement under warranty, or even if I'm willing to straight up pay, they tell me they aren't available. So now I carry a screwdriver and wrench on jobs. I spend about half my time putting the chain back on now-a-days vs cutting wood.
customer_reviews.author: B. Wagoner

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use, cuts as good as gas powered.
customer_reviews.text: We've had chainsaws our whole lives - but getting older makes trying to get a gas saw started too exhausting and maintenance is not fun. After charging, I've not run out of juice for 2-3 hours of cutting (not consistent cutting, but putting down to gather another log to cut). It is very quite and doesn't sound or appear that it is cutting as fast as a gas saw - but goes right through logs/trees, etc. like butter We've had it for 2 years now with no issues. I also love it because it doesn't scare me to use it (i.e. kick backs). I'm a women in her 60's
customer_reviews.author: Sincerely

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly decent piece of machine.
customer_reviews.text: Living on a property of almost 5 acres and 4 acres of it being woods, this is a pretty decent chainsaw for a homeowner. It wouldn’t be practical for lumberjack in the Northern Territory of Canada, but for backyard tasks it is perfect. Having owned a moody pull start gas chainsaw, it can be a pain in the a**. I can go work in the yard for a couple of hours using this chainsaw and get things done with the hassle and without wanting to throw it across the yard because it won’t start. Bonus if you get yourself an extra battery. Again, for the homeowner who is not taking down a mighty redwood...nice piece to add to the collection.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph K.

customer_reviews.title: and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Truly impressive chain saw. It actually cut faster than a 41 cc gas chain saw (with a new chain). There is so little vibration, that the cuts are thin and straight. Very quiet, well balanced, and easy to use. The only downside is the run time. It only lasts 15 minutes on a 2 amp hour battery, and then you wait 50 minutes for a full recharge. 15 minutes equaled 8 cuts through a 22 inch diameter hard wood tree. The is one tool that needs a spare battery, or two.
customer_reviews.author: Mechanical Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Really like the pick-up and go of this saw for a ...
customer_reviews.text: Really like the pick-up and go of this saw for a moderately ambitious home owner and for winter falls. I've used it to cut down a few trees between 5"-14" in diameter and bucked them. It has thrown the chain a few times, but I am erring on user error rather than item issues. Charger works great and fast! I bought a second battery for ease-of-use, but the battery recharges within 20 minutes, so it's not a major delay even without a back-up. But not having to do a lot of in between maintenance and fiddle with gas engine and cranking issues at this price range- great product for me!
customer_reviews.author: Ovdk

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Chainsaw!
customer_reviews.text: I had a 20" Poulan Pro and this is even more powerful than that. Very lightweight compared to that one also. You have to get two batteries if you plan on cutting for more than 45 min. That's how long the battery lasts cutting non stop. So glad I purchased this!
customer_reviews.author: pnovak

customer_reviews.title: Battery and charger do NOT work
customer_reviews.text: I received the chainsaw about a month ago. Went to charge the battery and it did not work !! I can’t use it with out a charge battery so I don’t know how it works... I send a message to greenworks about 3weeks ago but I still have not heard back from them. I just sent another message to them will see if they get back to Me or not ! 😖
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Cox

customer_reviews.title: cutting down trees and wood that make you smile when your done at how fast and easy it was
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I know, a battery operated chain saw really, well yes. This thing surprised a person who has used many gas and even a corded chain saw. As someone who wants to just get the job done, you can't go wrong. Many times I would get tired just starting my old saws now, I just grab it pop the battery in and go to town, cutting down trees and wood that make you smile when your done at how fast and easy it was. I have owned other GreenWorks products for yrs. and if this lasts like all there other products it's an A+ buy. I can tell you it will cut bigger logs and trees then you think.
customer_reviews.author: Birdman

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product. Main trouble with gas operated chainsaws is ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. Main trouble with gas operated chainsaws is getting them going. No problem here, and I haven't noticed any significant reduction in power. My needs are not super heavy duty, but I have a wooded lot and do a fair amount of work, and so far this runs much better than I expected. Battery will run down so you can't keep cutting for hours, but for the average householder it is quite good.
customer_reviews.author: JFKeiler

customer_reviews.title: It's not 18 inches
customer_reviews.text: I have a GreenWorks 14 inch chainsaw. It measures 14 inches from where it comes out of the shield to the end. This one measures 17 inches using the same measurement. I was expecting all 18 inches, this is not much difference from the 14 inch.
customer_reviews.author: J. bracco

customer_reviews.title: Good for small jobs only!
customer_reviews.text: this chainsaw is good enough for my purpose which is preparing wood for turning. However its battery life and power aren't adequate for a big job, such as cutting down a medium tree. So depending on your need, it may or may not be acceptable. I have several other Greenworks product, and use of a common battery make it convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Massoud Vaziri

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly powerful!
customer_reviews.text: I've never used a gas powered chainsaw (only corded electric), so I can't compare this to one of those. I bought it when a storm came through and knocked down some limbs that I couldn't reach with my corded chainsaw. The limbs ranged from 1-2 feet in diameter and this chewed through them like butter! Very pleased, so far!
customer_reviews.author: Bob From Springfield

customer_reviews.title: The power tool I use most
customer_reviews.text: I use this tool almost daily. It has almost as much power as my 18 inch gas-powered chainsaw that I just got rid of because this electric is far easier to use and maintain, not to mention the lighter weight. I don't know why anyone still uses gas powered equipment. I have the Greenworks lawnmower as well and sold the gas driven one. Both have plenty of power.
customer_reviews.author: M. S. Michels

customer_reviews.title: Best Cain Saw for Home
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly easy to use... light weight, no vibration and quiet. Cut down 3 trees limbed and bucked... plus one more just limbed only... used one battery charge plus about a third of the charge....
customer_reviews.author: Janos Sz.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: This electric power chain saw bears my "Sears Craftsman" saw hands down! One item to keep in mind - is that the chain lubricant system keeps feeding oil even when not in use... so it looks like a leak - just be aware and keep the saw stored in area where the oil stains won't matter.
customer_reviews.author: PJM

customer_reviews.title: I hear my neighbor's equipment over mine!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with the mower and string trimmer. Working on my lawn/yard is no longer a production - mixing fuels with oil, pulling starter cords, dealing with noise, vibration, fumes and oil. It is push button quiet. I actually hear my neighbor's equipment over my equipment while working on my lawn! The chain saw is quiet but gets the job done for the work I need. It is big enough for trimming and felling small (4"-6") trees and branches. Everything is still new so we'll see how it holds up over time but right now, I am surprised and delighted.
customer_reviews.author: QM

customer_reviews.title: My first battery powered chainsaw. Outstanding!
customer_reviews.text: My first battery powered chainsaw. I got the 80 V with 4 A. I am extremely impressed. The battery life is very good and the power and the chainsaw is great as well. Much easier than the gas powered chainsaws I’ve had in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Way easier to use than a gas powered chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with what this tool can do. That said, it's not a toy so make sure you know what you are doing with it if you buy one.
customer_reviews.author: R. Pullan

customer_reviews.title: Poor execution of a great idea
customer_reviews.text: Beware. This saw smoked and flamed in the first TEN SECONDS of use. It's bad news for a great concept. Obviously, we're returning it, and will probably go gas again.
customer_reviews.author: excelwrite

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service is unable to be reached
customer_reviews.text: Cannot reach Customer Service to replace the battery. The battery I received was defective. I understand that due to Covid wait times may be longer, but we have emailed and called since June 7th and NOTHING!! Very unhappy customer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's Electric?
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. I was skeptical about what it could do, but it chewed through huge logs better than some 18" 2-cycle gas saws I've used. I was able to take down AND cut up a small/medium tree (~30 feet tall) on one charge. Being able to cut without earplugs and not having the horrible smell and lingering sense of 2-cycle in my nose is an added benefit... and definitely much healthier! Only negative is that the bar/chain tool doesn't seat very tightly into the handle and falls out as you're cutting. Do yourself a favor and put that thing aside, or you'll be on a sawdust scavenger hunt.
customer_reviews.author: Brad R

customer_reviews.title: This gizmo and a suitable battery-powered sawzall is all you ...
customer_reviews.text: This gizmo and a suitable battery-powered sawzall is all you need to cleanup your yard. I'm considering adding tha nifty Black and Decker jaw tool on a stick so I don't need to raise this guy up above my head. It's not that it's heavy - it's not - but the chain tends to fall up at the high angle. Small tool shop guy had never seen one, and had very high praise for it, the value proposition, and even the chain quality, which he said will take 4 or 5 sharpenings. Same guy said to use the sawzall at ground level instead of the chainsaw.
customer_reviews.author: Mdeadly

customer_reviews.title: Convenient
customer_reviews.text: Good chain saw, battery lasts long enough for light use. The saw works fine, easy to take chain cover on/off to clean and remove debris. So nice not having to start/stop like a gasoline model, just push a trigger. No mess with gas refilling/oil additive.
customer_reviews.author: M. Macala

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: We now have a lawnmower, trimmer, leaf blower and chainsaw and 3 batteries and charging units. All work just fine and are quieter than gas equipment, lightweight and very mobile due to no extension cords. Hopefully, they will last 5 or more years.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas G. Smith

customer_reviews.title: It's a Bust
customer_reviews.text: I got a lot more cuts than I thought I would with one charge. It's real sweet... UPDATE; It only worked through one charge. After recharging the battery the saw would run less than a minute and quit. The saw's red light would start blinking. The battery was fine. Tried to get it resolved with Greenworks and after more than a month still no reply from them. Going to the BBB and my CC company. Also when I sent an email the company changed the wording of MY email twice. SO BOGUS. I am a Master Mechanic and I couldn't get the saw going.
customer_reviews.author: Richard M.

customer_reviews.title: The end of gas chainsaws?
customer_reviews.text: I have been running chain saws for 50 years now. We have heated with wood for the entire time. I think I know how to use them well. At age 78, I am now unable to pull the starter rope on my gas power because of a shoulder replacement and lack of rotator cuff. The cordless saw solves all the problems for me. There is no noise, fumes, or fuel mixing with it. Also, when I set it down on the ground while moving a log it stops instantly instead of idling on the ground picking up dirt. I have shown it to several neighbors who plan to buy a GreenWorks saw for themselves. This thing works great!
customer_reviews.author: James L. Stanfield

customer_reviews.title: Good tools.
customer_reviews.text: I have had these products since 2018 and they seem to be reliable and good. I had a part go out and customer service contacted me today to resolve.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I have never used an electric saw before but now I am hooked. Works every bit as good as my Poulan Pro 42cc, and in some ways better. I bought it for smaller jobs but found it did well cutting down trees (with diameters longer than the bar itself) as well. I would give it 5 stars if it weren't for the battery life. It lasted about 20 minutes, after which I had to put the battery back on the charger. I had enough wood cut that I simply switched to chopping while the battery recharged. Love the saw but it looks like spare batteries are going to be on my mas and birthday lists,,,,
customer_reviews.author: Gary Sims

customer_reviews.title: Greenworks Pro does it again!
customer_reviews.text: I took this chainsaw and used to to cut up 4 fallen branches. Some was 1 ft wide pin oak. No hesitation, aggressive while being quiet enough to not need ear plugs. Put in oil, check the chain, turn it on, and off you go! Another great member of the Greenworks Pro family. I now have 5 products.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and quiet.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful power, very quiet, easy to adjust tightness. Friends have used it and been impressed with how it cuts. Only ding is that it seems to leak more chain oil than my old gas saw. Have to keep it on a plastic tray to contain. I also bought Greenworks blower and am happy.
customer_reviews.author: wudger

customer_reviews.title: It is Quiet!
customer_reviews.text: It is a very handy tool. It does not cut quite as fast as my old gas saw but I think it is because of the chain being a safety anti kickback. I don't know if it will take a standard chain. it is great for intermittent work or when you are in an awkward position, no pulling starter cord, just push a button. No worries about old gas in the tank for a saw that may lie idle.
customer_reviews.author: EDWARD H.

customer_reviews.title: We own 3 of these bad boys!!
customer_reviews.text: We own 3 different GreenWorks machines! I have a blower, a 18 inch chainsaw, and a weedeater. My review of these things? Friggin awesome!!! We have over 3 acres of crazy yard and the three of these own our yard! Plenty of power, easy swapping out between units with a common battery, long time between charges. Yes with the battery the units are a little heavy but if you are serious about power these things kick butt!! I just took down a tree this weekend and the chainsaw cut into it like butter. Do yourself a favor and say good bye to stupi power cords and gas.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Kennelly

customer_reviews.title: Buy a Chain Sharpener
customer_reviews.text: You need a chainsaw sharpener. I had 2 weeks and bought 3 chains. I was too lazy to sharpen the chain. But if the chain is sharp it works great.
customer_reviews.author: MIKE MAC

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Cuts much better than expected, I'm impressed. You need a big batter for this tool if you'tr going to use for a day of cutting. The bucking teeth don't bite the log well and the saw is very heavy with the battery installed.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Chirico

customer_reviews.title: The concept of a cordless/electric appeals to people like me that do not cut wood professionally
customer_reviews.text: I might be writing this prematurely because I only used it twice so far. My house is heated primarily with wood and I have never paid for the wood. Using gas powered chain saws over the years became a chore if you are familiar with how finnicky small 2-cycle engines can be. The concept of a cordless/electric appeals to people like me that do not cut wood professionally. Charge the battery for 30 minutes and you are good to go. Now we will see how DURABLE it will be. A noble experiment.
customer_reviews.author: David Volpe

customer_reviews.title: The saw works great BUT the 2 nuts that hold the blade onto ...
customer_reviews.text: The saw works great BUT the 2 nuts that hold the blade onto the saw are constantly vibrating loose regardless of how much I tighten them. I've replaced them with nuts that were sitting around my shed and the problem is gone. So far I've cut down 2 30' trees around a 1' or a little more in diameter and I am impressed. This chainsaw is much better than the Poulon pro I bought a couple of years ago that seems to constantly stop working..
customer_reviews.author: Pagano's

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC
customer_reviews.text: This saw is a perfect fit for a non-woodsman home owner. The safety features are great. The saw does as good a job as my same sized gas chainsaw and with less mess. My only minor complaint at this point is the bar chain oil leaks out a little even with the cap on super tight. All in all a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Beu

customer_reviews.title: Good light use saw.
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of power for typical yard work, power button is a little tricky to push with gloves, and chain was no where near correctly adjusted out of the box and took a couple of tries to get it dialed in. Seems like it will be a great saw for the occasional and light duty of most homeowners. Especially if you already have other parts of the system that use the batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Desoto61

customer_reviews.title: Small Engines Suck...This Is The Cure
customer_reviews.text: All I know is every time I pick up a gas powered trimmer, chainsaw or blower...there's a problem. This chainsaw has been awesome so far. I pick it up, it works. I have cut down several small trees with it and used it to limb up on others. It's great, I love it; in it a perfect world it would come with 2 batteries but we all know why it doesn't $$$
customer_reviews.author: Alison W.

customer_reviews.title: really nice chainsaw!
customer_reviews.text: This is great for me, it is not too heavy like a gas-powered saw but has the power of one. The battery charges quickly and lasts a pretty long time even with cutting a decent size tree down and then into sections. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a chainsaw that does not want to have to pull start and mess around with a gas-powered one.
customer_reviews.author: J F

customer_reviews.title: Saw cuts well
customer_reviews.text: Saw cuts well, battery life is totally dependent on the size of the wood you are working on. The small stuff, it will cut for a long time . bigger stuff, will eat battery. Will be buying a second battery. Overall I like the power. when the chain is sharp, it is impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Dave R

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome - already had the blower and weed eater and this completes my set. I have taken down several trees without a problem - no hassle with pull cords or gas- I like the battery life- I keep a second battery charging and just swap them out on long cutting days.
customer_reviews.author: Theodore B.

customer_reviews.title: Great saw! Needs more battery...
customer_reviews.text: This chainsaw work amazing, cuts medium hard to soft wood without hesitation. The only down side I've encountered was it's low capacity factory battery. Standard is a 80v 2.0ah battery, however to run like a 45cc saw it needs a 4.5ah or better to have an effective run time including cool down. Over all great saw for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Instant run, plenty of power, No Gas Needed
customer_reviews.text: Used it cut off 10-12" limb from tree and then cut it into firewood sized segments. For homeowners who infrequently need a chain saw but want something with some power this is perfect. No more having to worry about the quality of the gas you left in the chainsaw when you last used it a year ago. Or discover you've run out of the two cycle blended gas. Just pop the battery in and start cutting. We made short work of the large branch we had to cut.
customer_reviews.author: Terry W.

customer_reviews.title: I replaced my small saw with it. The saw ...
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my small saw with it. The saw has plenty of power cuts fast and is quiet. I have cut a lot of fire wood with it with no issues. We use it in our business to trim and clear road ways and it is always ready to go. I did buy extra batteries so we could keep cutting. With a half hour charge time you don't run out of charged batteries. Let me put it this way I am done before the saw is. The saw has exceeded all my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: It's June 2019 and we're still cleaning up after Hurricanes Florence and Michael last fall. This chain saw has made the job soooo much less difficult and aggravating. Terrific tool.
customer_reviews.author: Carolina Cowgirl

customer_reviews.title: good product but battery was defective
customer_reviews.text: the chainsaw works well, but with another battery. the original one was delivered defective, and after emailing them as directed, and receiving an email in reply that they had received my notice, I have not had any further reply. I tried calling but after 25 minutes on hold, I gave up.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Sadusk

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, exactly what I hoped for
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd Greenworks 80V chainsaw, the first being the pole saw. I own 2 Stihl gas saws, which are the best of the gas powered saws and almost never use them anymore because this saw is awesome, cuts like a demon and I never have to mix gas, worry about a gummed up carburetor, change spark plugs or air filters again. It’s a little heavy and while nothing is perfect, this saw is as close to it as I could ever hope for.
customer_reviews.author: Lowell Grant

customer_reviews.title: Greenworks Pro 18" saw gets it done.
customer_reviews.text: Came in fast and is what the seller said it was. Very quiet. The only thing I would have to say is that the batteries don't last as long as I have been lead to believe by videos I say online. The price was GREAT. We use it in the back country when we are packing our stock. Cuts great and less to carry with it. Heavier than a gas saw but so much safer and quieter.
customer_reviews.author: Mongoose

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cutter...gas replacement without question!
customer_reviews.text: This is my new favorite. I've made a lovely pile of wood for winter off cleared land for housing development. This thing can't be stopped...cuts hard and fast, lasts a long time with the 4ah battery, and feels good in the hands. Just be sure you tighten the nuts on it before first use! I didn't check and one of them vibrated off (wouldn't have if it were tight, they're locking nuts). I escaped with no injury, but did have to go purchase a replacement nut as the one that it came with was lost in a large pile of brush.
customer_reviews.author: KyleSA

customer_reviews.title: very dependable and easy to maintain
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical of battery chainsaws but I already had the batteries for an 80V lawnmower, so this seemed like a good investment. And it really was!
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Wittik

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful
customer_reviews.text: I only need a chainsaw once every few years, but when I need it, I really need it. I bought this one because I don't want to deal with having to drain the gas after use because I might not use it again for a long time. I used it for a few downed limbs to test it, and was very impressed with the power cutting through 12" pieces. It seemed as powerful as my gas one. I don't know how long the battery will last, but it is perfect for my needs - and draining the chain/bar oil after use was easy.
customer_reviews.author: GC

customer_reviews.title: Convenience of not having to pull the starter is WONDERFUL!
customer_reviews.text: I am a 72 year old woman. I love this chainsaw. Easy start. Light enough to lift over my head to cut cedar limbs. Powerful enough to cross cut logs to prep for bowl turning. Portable (no cord) enough to carry into the woods in search of the perfect tree.
customer_reviews.author: BRO & the Geneband

customer_reviews.title: Works great with the more aggressive OREGON 91VXL062G 62 Drive Link ...
customer_reviews.text: Get the 4.0 Ah battery - it's well worth it if you are doing anything more than a few simple cuts. Works great with the more aggressive OREGON 91VXL062G 62 Drive Link Long Top Plate 3/8-Inch Low Profile Chain. No complaints. I've been very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon P.

customer_reviews.title: Greenworks needs Qc dept or amazon
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in amazon received a 18 inch 80 volt chainsaw greenworks battery did not work still waiting for a new battery and then I find out there is a recall on my unit. Waiting for parts on chainbreak to fix that. Got a 80v blower 3yrs ago and that battery was bad. Feed up with amazon and greenworks
customer_reviews.author: william molineux

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: I no longer use my gas chain saw. This cut as good as any gas saw I've used and I don't have to worry about it not starting!!! I didn't time the battery but it lasted as long as I needed. And it charges quickly. I've had no problem with the blade getting too loose too quickly. But when it does loosen, it is easy to adjust. Nothing not to like about this saw. I liked it so much I bought the weed eater. I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: S Force

customer_reviews.title: Added some chain oil and a battery and it was ready to go
customer_reviews.text: With this purchase I've transitioned from gas/oil burners in the yard to battery power. Less maintenance, easy and clean to use and ready to go without having to deal with hard to start engines or tangled electric cords. Light weight and strong too.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Krueger

customer_reviews.title: Three trees on one battery
customer_reviews.text: bought an extra battery, charged both, went through three trees, swapped batteries went through three more came back and the battery had already recharged, only concern I had was if I am away from a power source recharging batteries but I have a 4kw generator so no concern I guess.
customer_reviews.author: S. Will

customer_reviews.title: Not for heavy use
customer_reviews.text: Good thing a maintenance tool was included. You will need it if you attempt to do any heavy cutting. Tried to cut a chord of 12" thick oak logs. Battery lasts 20 minutes but takes 45 minutes to charge. Threw a chain after 60 minutes of use and several battery recharges. Lost a bar lock nut when it came loose during use making the saw useless until I find a replacement nut. Since they are all made in China, impossible to find a 8 mm flange lock nut.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Kvetan

customer_reviews.title: GREAT chainsaw!
customer_reviews.text: my husband loves this chainsaw. we received it, charged it fully and then went to sawing. We chopped down an entire apple tree (pretty dense wood) - then we went camping that following weekend and cut down several trees for firewood all on the same charge. I would recommend this chainsaw to anyone. No hassle with it starting, it works GREAT! We replaced our gas one with this one and could not be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this chainsaw, as indicated in other reviews. Easily able to cut through 15" downed trees. Good battery life, really does have power of petrol saw. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Best, and I own 4 chainsaws
customer_reviews.text: This is my go to chainsaw, and I own four. It's my go to for quick jobs, because it always starts, runs, and is ready to go. The only downside is that the battery only lasts about 10 minutes of active chainsawing. Which was enough to fell and cut an entire oak into 2' sections.
customer_reviews.author: C. Sorenson

customer_reviews.title: NO MORE GAS/OIL OR HEADACHES
customer_reviews.text: I heat with wood, I hate 2 cycle gas engines. This chainsaw is the answer. It is a beast, well built and cuts what I need. Even if I drain the battery I can split and stack while it re-charges. Update: This saw continues to impress. It powers through wood and allows me to be more productive since the gas, oil mix, will it start? headaches are gone. Its also great to be able to store it in my backseat for camping and not have to worry about gas fumes.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas S.

customer_reviews.title: Powerful but you better own LOTS of batteries
customer_reviews.text: This thing is powerful but its battery life is just awful. Cant even take down an 16 inch tree without having to recharge. Its a bit of a joke really. What good does it do to have power if it only lasts a few minutes!
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Works Like a Charm
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Battery was already fully charged. Chain tension was perfect. Just added oil, turned it on, and cut up a tree that fell in my yard. No ear protection needed, no need to recharge to finish the job. Recharged after done. Was down to two bars. Fully recharged in less than 30 minutes. No fuss, no mess. Relatively light weight so easy for a petite female to use.
customer_reviews.author: brick house

customer_reviews.title: Instruction Book
customer_reviews.text: Could not reach customer support. I was missing my instruction book. Yes I know I can download it! Would like to have it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hiers

customer_reviews.title: all the power a home owner needs.
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to fully run down the battery in one go. This machine chews through sweetgum and fallen pine as well as any 50cc class gas chainsaw I have used. We used it to reclaim wood from an old baby grand piano, This saw just cut the nicest straight lines through spruce, maple and oak beams easily. The 100 year old spruce sound board cut cleanly and with little chipping, thanks to the chain speed afforded by the 80v power system. This saw is what you need.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher perry

customer_reviews.title: Much safer when elevated.
customer_reviews.text: Using this saw in a lift was much easier than using a gas powered saw. No need to pull a string plus having it turn completely off between cuts made it easier to make a few cuts, re-position, make more cuts, etc. Plus, it had more than enough power to keep up with the gas saws we were running. When it needed to re-charge, it was a good time to sit and drink water for a little break anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Freimuth

customer_reviews.title: Cuts like a Boss!
customer_reviews.text: Cuts just as good as my Husq but SO quiet. You don't need ear protection with this. I really like the not hassle start and no fumes! ( No spark plugs to mess with). If you're worried this isn't as good as gas I wouldn't. You might need an extra battery for a big job but other than it's good to go.
customer_reviews.author: T. Whittaker

customer_reviews.title: Great chainsaw for suburbia
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy enough chainsaw for any suburbia task. I did some heavy pruning in our backyard and used this saw to cut up branches and limbs less than or equal to 4”. Single 2 ohm 80v battery Got through 30+ cuts with no problem
customer_reviews.author: Elijah D. Kreider

customer_reviews.title: I like this saw and now rarely use my small gas powered chainsaw.
customer_reviews.text: Saw is quiet, low vibration and works great on wood up to 8 inches in diameter. Probably because of lower RPM it holds its sharpness longer than my gas chainsaws. The chain needs to be fairly tight as there is a tendency for it to jump off the bar. The rating would have been 5 stars except I have had to replace two oil caps that unscrewed and were lost to the forest floor. I now have a hose clamp attached to the cap which keeps it from backing off. jws
customer_reviews.author: jws

customer_reviews.title: Cuts through wood with ease, long battery life.
customer_reviews.text: I've been needing this chainsaw for a long time. It cuts well and not to heavy. I'm 72 years old and love it.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia H. Mire

customer_reviews.title: This is the future for small cutting like home firewood
customer_reviews.text: This is the future for small cutting like home firewood. I use both this and a gas chainsaw. It has it's place and saves $ on gas for the smaller wood. It will run about 30 minutes and 30 minutes to charge when empty. Go get a coffee or Coke while it charges and your ready to go again.Keep an eye on the bar oil one fill per charge on mine. It is strong but will freak you out if you are used to a gas chainsaw because it's quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Kubiak

customer_reviews.title: Goes through bar oil fast which is probably a good thing for the chain
customer_reviews.text: Goes through bar oil fast which is probably a good thing for the chain. Is on the heavy side and you will need to use both hands. This saw will cut! Don't know if I would buy this to cut a cord of wood, but for the occasional use for cutting limbs, it is great. Update - Seems like the chain slips off the bar pretty easy, even when tight. Never had this issue with other chainsaws over 50 years of using a chainsaw. Not sorry I bought it, but would not buy it again because it is so heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Rod Farmer

customer_reviews.title: This chainsaw make my life better. Tired of setting the choke just right
customer_reviews.text: This chainsaw make my life better. Tired of setting the choke just right, pushing the gas feed bulb exactly 5.5 times and pulling a a cord until your elbow unhinges? Get this saw. Battery life is about 20 minutes per charge. Less than advertised. So what. Everything is less than advertised. This saw actually cuts..a legit replacement for a 45cc gas with little noise, ultimate dependability, low vibration, good weight balance. This is my first Amazon review. I do it to tell you brother/sister buy this saw and it will improve your life.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer M. Sheehy

customer_reviews.title: As powerful as gas chainsaw without all hassles of gas.
customer_reviews.text: Works great .. very powerful ... especially considering it's cordless. Seems to be as much power as a regular chainsaw. Also safer as turns off wen you let go of switch. Remember you need Chain oil as well when you buy this (can find at any home depot or lowes) ... which needs to be added before using. Battery seems to last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Mike D

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for home users
customer_reviews.text: Quick and easy to cut smaller items. No where close to the power and speed of stihl 3 series . Nice to not have to start and gas.
customer_reviews.author: evil

customer_reviews.title: stay away
customer_reviews.text: bad quality and design, first is the battery doesn't work after receiving the product, then it broke down in about 1.5 year year.
customer_reviews.author: JZhao

customer_reviews.title: Battery operated tools are getting better all the time!
customer_reviews.text: I am using the back pack to hold the battery and it makes a big difference. Removing the weight from the tools because of the battery allows you to work more effectively.
customer_reviews.author: jjrunt

customer_reviews.title: This can replace a gas chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: Battery life isn't exactly what they claim. I get about 30 or so good cuts that are 8-14" in diameter. But the power is exceptional. If the chain is properly tightened it cuts through trees like butter. I love having the battery, which only takes about 45 minutes to charge. Only complaint is the batteries are super expensive.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Greenworks is the best!
customer_reviews.text: Like all other Greenworks products. This works amazing. We own a Landscaping company and switched all our tools to Greenworks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Chain comes off all the time.
customer_reviews.text: Works good but the chain falls off constantly even after adjusting it with every cut. I also have a 12 inch saw that works great.
customer_reviews.author: Cola1bear

customer_reviews.title: Came missing wrench needed to adjust chain
customer_reviews.text: This chainsaw came without the wrench needed for adjusting the chain like it was supposed to. I called customer service and was told they didn't have any in stock and didn't have any on back order. What a terrible way to run a business!!
customer_reviews.author: topkick

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice
customer_reviews.text: Handles all my large oaks around my property with relative ease. Charges fast. Goodbye forever gas powered saws!
customer_reviews.author: bpm3

product_meta.title: Greenworks Pro 80V 18-Inch Cordless Chainsaw, 2Ah Li-Ion Battery and Charger Included GCS80420,Green/Black
product_meta.description:
Style:2Ah Battery and Charger| Size:18-InchGreen Works is starting a revolution in outdoor power equipment starting with its Green Works Pro 80V Li-Ion MAX system. Combined with our DigiPro Brushless motor, this is the highest voltage, gas equivalent, commercial grade cordless outdoor power tool system in the industry. Featuring the simple electric start, light weight designs and quieter motor, professionals and heavy DIY'ers can now tackle tough jobs through variable terrain without the hassle of gas, fumes, heavy gear or delicate maintenance needs of gas powered engines. The evolution of Green Works lithium-ion technology and designs have made it possible for professionals to get their jobs done by simply snapping in a battery and pressing a button while delivering high performance power and longer run time to get the job done. Green Works Pro 80V Li-Ion MAX System features a Jet Blower, 18-inch Chainsaw, Hedge Trimmer, String Trimmer, Lawn Mower. With Green Works, we understand that it's not just a tool.it's your life.


 * NOTE: It is normal for oil to seep from the saw when not in use. To prevent seepage, empty the oil tank after each use then run for one minute.
feature_bullets: Up to 150 cuts with fully charged 2Ah Battery, Battery included
DigiPro Brushless motors are more reliable and delivers gas Equivalent performance to a 45cc gas engine
Steel bucking Spikes, durable metal wrap around handle and electronic chain brake for safe operation
Rapid 30 minute charge for standard 80V 2Ah Battery, multiple Battery capacity available.The GCS80420 is a well-designed machine made from hard plastic and metal
80V 2Ah Li-Ion Battery and charger included, compatible Battery and charger models GBA80200, GBA80400 and GCH8040

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars476 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
